document_notes.text:
This update for apache2 fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2022-23943: heap out-of-bounds write in mod_sed (bsc#1197098).
- CVE-2022-22720: HTTP request smuggling due to incorrect error handling (bsc#1197095).
- CVE-2022-22719: use of uninitialized value of in r:parsebody in mod_lua (bsc#1197091).
- CVE-2022-22721: possible buffer overflow with very large or unlimited LimitXMLRequestBody (bsc#1197096).
document_notes.title: Details

notes.text: A carefully crafted request body can cause a read to a random memory area which could cause the process to crash. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.52 and earlier.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: Apache HTTP Server 2.4.52 and earlier fails to close inbound connection when errors are encountered discarding the request body, exposing the server to HTTP Request Smuggling
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: If LimitXMLRequestBody is set to allow request bodies larger than 350MB (defaults to 1M) on 32 bit systems an integer overflow happens which later causes out of bounds writes. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.52 and earlier.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: Out-of-bounds Write vulnerability in mod_sed of Apache HTTP Server allows an attacker to overwrite heap memory with possibly attacker provided data. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4 version 2.4.52 and prior versions.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description
